user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_StatusToString:
```c
char *OS_StatusToString(osal_status_t status, os_status_string_t *status_string)
{
    char *string = NULL;

    if (status_string != NULL)
    {
        snprintf(*status_string, sizeof(*status_string), "%ld", OS_StatusToInteger(status));
        string = *status_string;
    }
    return string;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
snprintf(*status_string, sizeof(*status_string), "%ld", OS_StatusToInteger(status));
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: the call to snprintf is inside the if (status_string != NULL) block and is therefore reachable when the condition holds. Also sizeof(*status_string) does not evaluate a dereference at runtime, so there is no hidden unreachable path. No unreachable code is present in the fragment.
